answers.answer: Yes, could be MS, and a neurologist can better make that diagnosis.  But could also be a circulatory problem or could also be diabetes.  Diabetes in particular will make it feel like you're walking on glass.  And if your circulation isn't up to par, your feet will turn colors.  As for your eyes, you did say you also had a twitch, which that can be caused by lack of good deep sleep.  So, I think your general doc should test you for diabetes and also find out if for some reason the blood is restricted that goes into your legs.  He should also look into your oxygenation levels, which is normally checked when they do your blood pressure.But now, the blurry eye that lasts all day, that COULD suggest MS, and, even tho your brain MRI came out okay, you could ask for a spinal MRI, too, sometimes you can have evidence of MS just in the spine, PLUS they can do a few other tests that might help confirm MS, because a small percentage of people can have MS with a perfectly okay MRI of brain and spine.  Diagnosis of MS is tricky, so could be your general physician should go ahead and refer you to a neurologist to determine if MS can be ruled out or in.But blurry eye, that could also happen from glaucoma readings getting too high, so an opthalmologist should probably be another doc you should visit.  And then there's the possibility that IF you have been using, for example, a hydrocortisone type cream for a skin cut or whatever, if you get it in your eye, it can blur it up, plus it will make it feel irritated.  Those are just a couple other things to look into.

question: symptoms started about 6 -7 months ago.  burning/numbness in both feet, mainly  accross toes. and worst on big to. feels like walking on glass. sometimes its so bad cannot feel feet. Red patches accross toes. they feel so freezing cold at time, with terrible stinging. also happens in my fingers. would come and go at times, but now mosty stays all the time.  i get fast twitches in lft eye. and now rt eye would  get blurry, and clear up very fast. last 2 times eye went so blurry and did not clear up till next day. i will sometimes get tingling in back of head lt side . crawling feeling. I went to my gp he orderd  just a dry brain mri, which did not show ms. just an empty sella. had sono of legs done, this was perfectly normal.  at times eyes will flutter. The numbness sometimes moves around to legs in back if i am sitting  too long.. I am a female 48 and very healthy, do these symptoms sound like ms?
title: could these be ms symptoms
